messages.title: Labour policies for a better Britain
messages.content: Labour will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour and give all workers full rights from day one. ... Labour will build a Britain for the many.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour and give all workers full rights from day one.
Set up a national investment bank and regional development banks including Bank of the North to unlock £500 billion to fund major capital projects and finance growth and good jobs.
Protect pensioners and guarantee the Triple Lock on pensions until 2025.
Always give the NHS the money it needs. Keep services at the Pilgrim Hospital and Skegness hospital open.
Invest to tackle the crisis in social care and join up services from home to hospital with a properly integrated health and social care system.
Focus on reducing class sizes and driving up teaching standards, introducing universal free school meals for primary children, and reintroducing the Education Maintenance Allowance.
Invest in new affordable homes to rent and buy, building over a million new homes in five years, with at least half of them for social rent.

issues.brexitEurope: A Tory Brexit will hurt our community, only Labour will deliver a Brexit that will protect the many. We need to ensure that we get a Brexit deal that is right for the people of this constituency.
issues.economy: We will set up a national investment bank and regional development banks. ... to help unlock £500 billion to fund major capital projects and finance growth and good jobs.
issues.education: We will focus on what matters most in our schools: reducing class sizes and driving up teaching standards. ... free school meals for primary school children. ... reintroduce an Education Maintenance Allowance.
issues.government: I'm standing in this General Election for Boston and Skegness because I believe it is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools and make sure we have proper recruitment and retention policies to keep our services local to our towns.
issues.health: Labour will always give the NHS the money it needs. Keeping services at the Pilgrim Hospital and Skegness hospital open.
issues.immigration: Leaving the EU will mean an end to free movement of labour, but I do believe we need to give a guarantee to all EU citizens who work within Boston & Skegness to let them remain.
issues.socialWelfare: Labour will invest to tackle the crisis in social care and will join up services from home to hospital with a properly integrated health and social care system.

community.content: I'm standing in this General Election for Boston and Skegness because I believe it is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools and make sure we have proper recruitment and retention policies to keep our services local to our towns.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm standing in this General Election for Boston and Skegness because I believe it is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools and make sure we have proper recruitment and retention policies to keep our services local to our towns. ... I do not intend to go to Parliament to forget the important issues that affect our town.

examples: help unlock £500 billion to fund major capital projects
We will invest in new affordable homes to rent and buy, building over a million new homes in five years, with at least half of them for social rent.
It is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools
Labour will build a Britain for the many
We need to stop starving our schools, roads, and other key public services of the resources they desperately need, including a properly funded social care system for our elderly.
Labour will introduce a real Living Wage of £10 per hour and give all workers full rights from day one.
Leaving the EU will mean an end to free movement of labour, but I do believe we need to give a guarantee to all EU citizens who work within Boston & Skegness to let them remain.
A Tory Brexit will hurt our community, only Labour will deliver a Brexit that will protect the many.

nonPolicyAttributes.localness: I'm standing in this General Election for Boston and Skegness because I believe it is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools and make sure we have proper recruitment and retention policies to keep our services local to our towns.

examples: I'm standing in this General Election for Boston and Skegness because I believe it is essential that we fund our hospitals and schools and make sure we have proper recruitment and retention policies to keep our services local to our towns.
